Hello Dave,

Based on the images, it needs to be determined whether this sw=
ord has 
been exposed to serious heat. The scaly-dry appearance of the stee=
l 
is an indication that it might have been. Fires were a problem 
througho=
ut Japan's history that affected many swords. There are 
articles written t=
hat describe to some degree what characteristics to 
look for. 
In general,=
 this is one lesson many beginners unfortunately 
experience at one time or=
 another. 

regards,
Franco

o what is seen in the picture.

een in the upper section

need of polish.  It 
> laid on the battlefield at Okinawa during WWll for s=
everal days 
> before being discovered by a young Marine.  It was stored aw=
ay with 
> little or no attention since.  Oddly, the sword seemed to have 
=
found 
> me as opposed to the other way around.
> 
> I'm trying to research=
 the sword and have a little knowledge from 
> research I did on swords my =
Father brought home from WWll as a 11th 
> Airborne Paratrooper.  I didn't =
realize what I was getting into!

from Ron and Ricky.  I still

 sword is most likely a
